title: Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2007 (No. 37 of 2007), and with the approval of
heading: 1. Ordnance Survey Ireland, in exercise of the powers conferred on it by
text_raw:
1. Ordnance Survey Ireland, in exercise of the powers conferred on it by 
Section 17 of the Ordnance Survey Ireland Act, 2001 (No. 43 of 2001) as 
amended by Section 25 of the Markets in Financial Instruments and 
Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2007 (No. 37 of 2007), and with the approval of 
the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage and the approval of 
the Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform, hereby adopt the Rules For Pre-Existing Public Service Pension 
Scheme Members set out in S.I. No. 582 of 2014 for the purposes of the 
making of a Superannuation Scheme for the staff of Ordnance Survey Ireland, 
subject to the modifications set out in Article 4.

title: Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2007 (No. 37 of 2007), and with the approval of
heading: 4. The modifications referred to in Article 1 are as follows:
text_raw:
4. The modifications referred to in Article 1 are as follows: 

Membership 

(a) 

In Article 5 (2) (b), - 

“who is not a new entrant and whose actual pensionable service 
on attaining age 65 would be less than the vesting period, or” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place— 

“who is not a new entrant and whose actual pensionable service 
on attaining age 70 would be less than the vesting period, or” 

(b) 

In Article 5 (5), - 

“A member who is not a new entrant may not continue in 
membership after having reached the age of 65.” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place— 

“A member who is not a new entrant may not continue in 
membership after having reached the age of 70.” 

Contributions for Personal Scheme Benefits 

(c) 

In Article 7(3), – 

“5% of pensionable remuneration or,” is deleted. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th February, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [42] 3 

Survivor’s Pension - Calculation 

(d) 

In Article 29 (3) – 

“In the case where the former member dies while in receipt of a 
pension, other than a pension based on Article 18 (Cost Neutral 
Early Retirement), a preserved pension or a pension awarded on 
medical grounds,” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place – 

“In the case where the former member dies while in receipt of a 
pension, other than a pension based on Article 17 (Cost Neutral 
Early Retirement), a preserved pension or a pension awarded on 
medical grounds,” 

Appeals 

(e) 

In Article 52 of the Regulations – 

“The appeals provisions of the Pensions Act, as amended, and 
any enactment which amends or extends that Act and any 
Regulation, Warrant or Order made under that Act shall apply, 
including the Pensions Ombudsman Regulations.” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place— 

"If any dispute arises as to the claim of any person to, or the 
amount of, any superannuation benefit payable in pursuance of 
this scheme, such dispute shall be submitted to the Minister for 
Housing, Local Government and Heritage, who shall refer it to 
the Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan 
Delivery and Reform, whose decision shall be final." 

Entitlements of transferred persons 

(f) Article 54 is inserted as follows – 

“54. In accordance with section 17(7) of the Ordnance Survey 
Ireland Act, 2001, the benefits granted by Ordnance Survey 
Ireland under this Scheme to or in respect of a transferred person 
shall be subject to terms and conditions that are not less 
favourable than the terms and conditions in relation to the grant 
of superannuation benefits which applied 
the person 
immediately before the day on which the person was transferred 
to the employment of Ordnance Survey Ireland. In this Article a 
transferred person means a member of the staff of the former 
Ordnance Survey who was transferred to the employment of 
Ordnance Survey Ireland in accordance with section 15(1) of the 
Ordnance Survey Ireland Act, 2001 (No. 43 of 2001).”

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to adopt the Rules set out in the Schedule 
to the Rules for Pre-existing Public Service Pension Scheme Members 
Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 582 of 2014) as a scheme for the granting of 
superannuation benefits to, or in respect of, members of the staff of Ordnance 
Survey Ireland who are not members of the Single Public Service Pension 
Scheme.
